text: the new proposals been sent and now the
Greek Prime Minister must face his
country the government in Athens will
seek Parliament's approval later to
reinforce the message that their offer
is serious but there's a problem the
reforms package includes many of the
measures the Greek people rejected in
last Sunday's referendum and this time
the cuts are even greater the 13 page
document detailing its new bailout plan
include more taxes on businesses
including shipping companies an increase
on v80 for restaurants cuts in state
spending for pensions and a curb on
early retirement a 300 million euro cut
in defense spending by 2016 and the tax
breaks for its islands will also be
scrapped in all the government hopes to
make 12 billion euros and savings but in
exchange it wants much more from the
eurozone the realistic proposal from
Greece will have to be matched by an
equally realistic proposal on debt
sustainability from the creditors Greece
wants fifty three and a half billion
euros as part of a third bailout package
under restructuring of its huge debt
burden and a reminder of what that is
320 billion euros ahead of another round
of negotiations this was the mood on
Athens streets our welfare our
well-being our lives are at stake you
know the banks are closed we cannot get
our money out we've worked for it all
our lives
Greece was Europe before the Europeans
Greece has been in Europe for the past
3,000 years it's not possible for us to
leave we want to stay in Greece's reform
package will now be scrutinized by
experts from the European Commission the
Central Bank and the IMF the plan will
then be considered by eurozone finance
ministers on Saturday and by EU leaders
and Brussels on Sunday Katerina MO BBC
news
